reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Live in WPB, FL and needed a place to stay after attending a Brave spring training game in March 2007. Had recently spent a night at a $60 a night hotel here and it was dreadful. We decided to try spending $90 and see what we got. Some of the reviews of this hotel concerned me, and I am very fussy about cleanliness. But I figured it had to be better than the $60 a night room. Some people wrote that the hotel looked worn. The only areas that seemed to look "just a little worn" were the floor hallways. The lobby was in great shape. The entire hotel is decorated in a colorful, art deco style. The rooms were VERY clean. The bathrooms are updated and also VERY clean. The beds were fabulous and had those big comfortors and pillows that five star hotels have. The comfortors are surrounded by a sheet under and on top of, just like the five star hotels. It's great to not have to have a blanket that has touched who knows how many people, touching you :o). The front desk check in person was very friendly and the comp check in cookies were delicious. One caution - if you're looking for a quick breakfast, don't be tempted by the Au Bon Pain in the lobby. At least don't order the bacon and egg croissant sandwich. It was terribly bland. That's really the only negative thing I can say about this property. I loved it and will return.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel and Price

likes.disliked: — Au Bon Pain bacon and egg breakfast, although their baked goods looked yummy

reviews.text: Got to the hotel really late, after 22:00. The frontdesk was fantastic. They asked me if I had a good flight, and were really helpfull. Got shown to my room, which was really nice. Got a famous "Doubletree Chocolate Biscuit" in the room. View was ok, overlooking the main entrance, but was no noise at all.
reviews.title: Fantastic value for money!
dont stay here!
reviews.text: The hotel organise their own busses to the parks, so no need for cars or taxi's, and the busses all play Disney DVD while you are being driven down there, schedule is also very good.
The pool is very relaxing, nice and clean and big enough for a few laps before dinner.
reviews.title: worst hotel bed ever

likes.disliked: — the bed was hard as a rock

reviews.text: Bar and restaurant are nice, and the staff was friendly.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now I think I'm being kind rating this hotel as Okay but not everything was bad. Firstly check in was nice and the cookies after a long flight were lovely, a very nice touch I thought. The bar was fun and Lucy the barmaid is an absolute card! The stories she can tell. The free transportation to Disney was great, really easy to use, and the location is pretty good for getting around.
reviews.title: Would not return to the Doubletree at LBV

reviews.text: Now for the bad news. The hotel is not nice at all. We pulled up at 9pm (after a long flight) looked up and noticed most of the neon letters weren’t working which didn’t give a great first impression. We were shattered and walking into a musty and damp smelling room for the first time was horrid. The bedding was like something from the 70s and felt damp. The bathroom is very small and extremely tired looking and the noise from the air conditioning unit was so load you couldn’t sleep with it on. We were on the 16th floor but I hear that the 17th is nicer but is mainly for Hilton honours members? I don't know. The view was of a petrol station, restaurants and the many many lanes of traffic. It reminded me of being stuck on the M25. I was ready to scream some mornings when the cleaners were outside hovering and banging about at around 8am. I know you don’t go to Orlando to rest and stay in bed all day, don’t get me wrong, but after a whole days travelling from the other side of America (we went to Las Vegas first then on to Orlando), a little rest wouldn’t have gone a miss. The whole hotel is very tired looking and in serious need of a revamp but maybe, as they say, you get what you for, as I know the price is really good.
reviews.title: Hated it so much we switched hotels!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situation right on the entrance to Disney but you wouldn't want to walk it - really you wouldn't want to walk anywhere in Orlando. You've got six lanes of traffic to cross just to get a burger at this hotel. Being first timers to Orlando we originally wondered if it was just where the hotel was situated but after a trip up to International Drive we soon realised that that’s just Orlando. It's made for driving not walking.
reviews.title: Great value stay in a great place

reviews.text: That said we did really enjoy our time in Orlando - absolutely loved Disney, Universal and the water parks were so so much fun. The Ale House just across the street from the hotel was fantastic - real atmosphere and so cheap, but my god the food they must waste in that place - I've never seen a plate of nachos so big in my life! You could feed a family of four (or more) on those alone. There is actually a good selection of places to eat around the hotel - good Chinese buffet, great pizza place, IHOP, Sizzlers and of course the Ale House for anything you can think of. $5 bucket of beer won me over.
reviews.title: Nice stay at value price

likes.liked: — Value price, comfortable beds, close to WDW location
likes.disliked: — older, dated look; only one set of elevators, unsecured parking

reviews.title: excellent hotel
reviews.text: I would definitely go back to Orlando but I would never stay at this hotel. However it shows you that everyone’s different as we spoke to some families and couples who said it was the best holiday they’d ever had and they’d definitely come back to the hotel. Each to your own.

reviews.title: Agree with other poster - Beware at checkout
reviews.text: The hotel room was very nice and the price we got on Hotwire was excellent. However, when we checked out, there was a $3.20 charge (actually, 2 x $1.60 charges) for a hotel safe - there were no other charges on the bill since this was pre-paid via Hotwire. I was ok with 1 charge for a safe, but why were there 2? So we asked at the desk and they agreed to remove both charges - great! However, on getting my subsequent credit card bill, they had charged us $10.20 (rather than $3.20, or better yet $0 as they had agreed) - where did that amount come from? Apparently, once they have your credit card, they feel comfortable charging anything, regardless of whether or not it is justified or included on a bill that they give you.

reviews.title: Beware...This hotel is NO LONGER DOUBLETREE!!!!!!
reviews.text: Being a Hilton Honors member, I went to the their website to book a hotel for our trip. I found a really colorful hotel not far from Disneyworld and Universal Studios. I made my reservation for 8 nights back in December 2006 for my stay in January 2007.
Upon arrival, the first thing that I found inconvenient was the U-turn I had to make a block or so down just to get to the hotel from the I-4 freeway. There was no easier way.
reviews.title: Okay, but be careful on checkout

reviews.text: I did notice the hotel was again, very colorful. However, it did NOT have a sign out front or anything displaying the name or address. So I am grateful for the fact that it was colorful. That is how I found it.
reviews.title: Perfectly fine

reviews.text: Upon check-in, there was a HUGE disappointment! This is when I discovered that this hotel was no longer a Doubletree or affiliated with Hilton or AAA at all. So the points I thought I was accumilating and the service I was accustomed to wasn't obtainable.
reviews.title: sleep at last

reviews.text: Recently went to Orlando for a convention. The room was clean and the staff was good. I've come across a lot worse in Orlando for this price of $80 a night. I can't complain. It's not the Marriott but then again, you aren't paying for the Marriott.
reviews.title: Not bad for Orlando and the Price

reviews.text: This place was really bad. The lobby was dirty, cluttered, and outdated. The rooms were also in need of attention. Lamps and fixtures were rusty, and the air conditioner was loud. The room also had an odd odor. There was also urine on the elevator floor when I went to use it one morning. Transportation from this hotel was also difficult. The pool was suppossed to close at 10PM, but there were loud teenagers still using it at 11:30PM. Spend the extra money and stay somewhere else!
reviews.title: Really Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a week at the Double Tree back at the end of 2006 without the knowledge that the hotel was about to change ownership. After reading some of the reviews posted since the change of ownership we were worried about what to expect.
reviews.title: Great place Close to all the attractions

reviews.text: We arrived at the Orlando Vista Hotel after a long flight. At check in we were given Cookies which was a really welcome treat, our room was on the 7th Floor and had spectacular views over Orlando. The beds were extremely comfortable and the room had everything apart from a fridge.
reviews.title: We enjoyed our stay at the Orlando Vista Hotel

reviews.text: The swimming pool was heated and the hot tub was around 104 degrees.
reviews.title: Didn't Like It
